good morning everybody! it's me, professor payde fore the clown, professor of curation at delaware state clown college, here with another payde fore review!

everyone who is anyone knows that the fifth installment of a series is usually the best. remember rocky V where rocky fought against the evil soviet boxing robot? the fifth movie in the alien series where the aliens fought against the predator in the giant temple? leprechaun 5: leprechaun in the hood? i think you see my point, which is that all of those are all-time classics. i am happy to announce to the world that the treasures of montezuma 5 fits right in with them as one of the highlights of the match 3 genre.

i consider myself an expert at the match 3 genre(i present my 700+ hours on marvel puzzle quest as evidence), so i can tell you that this game has it all! nobody is trying to reinvent the wheel here. instead, i would say they have perfected the wheel. it is even rounder than before! montezuma 4 was a perfect circle, but now we can throw that circle right into the trash because they have brought us the perfectest circle(30% more perfect), and they call it treasures of montezuma 5! good golly miss molly! put on your dancing shoes and then take them off because you know you shouldn't be wearing shoes in the house!

if you have been looking for the next great match 3 game, your search is over! go ahead and kick back, put your feet up, and get ready to enjoy some puzzle perfection! you know you want to, and i assure you that this game is well worth the price of admission.  don't forget to tell them that your crazy uncle professor payde fore the clown sent you!

I'm a big fan of Montezuma serie and I'm really disappointed by this TM5.
Some problems are:
The game is quite short (6 hours for all stages), you cannot shuffle the board, the White Totem is available only at the end, there is no double activation of any totem, there are some random crash.
If you compare to TM3 (real challenge) or TM4 (big content), you will be really disappointed.
I don't recommend it, I would recommend TM4 or TM3 instead.

reviewText:
The Treasure of Montezuma 5 is the 5th game from the The Treasure of Montezuma series developed by Alawar. The game is a gem matching one with a variety of game modes: destroy tokens, collect gems(which is the most used one), collect flasks, find artifacts, collect fireflies, collect golden lizards, collect gold nugets and collect ancient amulets, and a total of 70 levels and 3 bonus level: destroy colored stones, destroy marbles and collect gems(can also be called classic mode) which have a basic time limit of 1 minute which can be extended via totems or bonuses.

In the last sentence I mentioned totems and bonuses. For each 5 completed levels you unlock a totem or a bonus(they come in the totem-bonus sequence). There are 7 totems, one for each gem color, and 6 bonuses, which can be upgraded four times in the store. The currency for the store is gems, which can be obtained by completing levels, completing the in-game achievements, from chests and from the slot machine. The rewards for completing achievements are gems and tokens for the slot machine. The chests each reward you with 150 gems and 3 tokens for the slot machine and require five golden keys which can be obtained by beating a given score for each level. The slot machine have 5 symbols: 10,20,30 gems , a token for the slot machine or a montezuma masks, making 3 masks giving you a jackpot, and 3 reels.

This is the first game that I play from the game series so I am unable to compare it with its predecessors.

The game doesn't feature a notable story. At the begining of the game you get informed that you get close to the ancient city of Aztec where Montezuma ruled and stored untold riches and that's all of it.

The music is good for concentration.

If you are interested in this aspect, the game feature trading cards, but lacks achievements.

Note - This game was reviewed using a key provided by the publisher.

Each new twist and turn will keep you on the edge of your seat as you visit the Store to upgrade the totems and bonuses, try your luck at the Slot Machine, and earn dozens of gratifying Achievements. Offering butter-smooth gameplay and jaw-dropping visuals, Treasures of Montezuma 5 breathes new and exciting life into the gem-matching genre and will provide hours of addictive fun! - Recommended!

reviewText:
[Review key provided by the publisher]
I only played TTOM3, so i'll mostly compare it to that game, without context of the rest of the series.

The Treasures of Montezuma is a fast, flashy, challenging match-three game with a lot of bonuses and upgrades.
In this installment the graphics ware switched to more bouncy and cartoony, while the gems remained very elaborate, which i don't really like. It seems like they tried to add some story, but abandoned that idea after obnoxious mobile-level restricting tutorial. Playing field is still cluttered and noisy, but super-score now is not that intrusive, on the flip side, now it's not as obvious as before, so you have to use audio cues to track it. Also it seems like it has a lot of f2p rudiments. Core scoring system became much easier, there are several money-grind levels, so you can buy more power-ups before retrying failed main level. But again, because of that, green statue became super OP on the early levels.

Works fine with nvidia surround. Unlike 3rd game this one works very stable.

Despite all the flaws it's one of the more challenging and complex games in the genre, while being definitely finite, which pleases my inner completionist and gives me incentive to play it. Finished it in one 7 hour sitting.
